title: About me
text: I’m Lee, a Health Psychology MSc student at the University of Bath. Alongside my studies, I’m on placement as a Research Assistant in the Department of Health at Bath researching why digital devices for physical activity are less effective for those from lower socioeconomic backgrounds.

title: Hello.
text:
I am currently a MSc Health Psychology student at the University of Bath on placement as a research assistant whilst completing my masters dissertation.
My research interests include health psychology, digital health, and health inequality; from October 2023 I will be starting a PhD at the University of Bath exploring how we can make digital health work better for those in lower socioeconomic groups.
Feel free to contact me using the links below.
I built this website on Quarto. To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.

title: Projects
text:
A project to identify the psychosocial mechanisms that might explain the digital divide in the efficacy of digital behavioural change interventions (DBCIs) for weight-related behaviours, such as diet and physical activity.
This project is being undertaken to meet the requirements of the MSc in Health Psychology at the University of Bath.
OSF

title: Projects
section: A scoping review into the mechanisms reported to explain the digital divide in the efficacy of digital interventions for weight related activities
text:
A scoping review into the mechanisms reported to explain the digital divide in the efficacy of digital interventions for weight related activities
Digital interventions for weight-related behaviours (diet, exercise) are less effective for those in lower socioeconomic groups. This scoping review will explore what psychosocial mechanisms have been reported to explain the digital divide in the efficacy of digital interventions for weight-related behaviours.
This project is a collaboration with researchers in the University of Bayreuth, Germany.
OSF
